hanzi-su-wiki:
溝

Значения

Водосточная канава, ров

Мнемоника

Водяной 氵 поток, направленный в деревянное русло 冓 (леса).

Варианты

沟

heisig_chinese_memo: A gutter is a ditch which funnels water.
heisig_constituent: gutter, water, water droplets, water pistol, funnel, cone, celery, again
koohiiStory2: A gutter takes the water that falls as rain and funnels it off to where it can be dealt with appropriately.
jp_example_words: 溝(こう): 10^38, hundred undecillion (American), hundred sextillion (British)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Tsunami vs lifeguard. Who will win? After the water drains away, we find the lifeguard in the gutter.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: To be fair, it's pretty obvious who would win. Nobody knows what that lifeguard was thinking.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: In the gutter is a lifeguard, so Emperor こういち decides to survey the damage.
WaniKani_Reading_Info:
"This lifeguard didn't believe in the power of kanji learning," こういち says to the press. "He was punished by the great Crabigator, who sent its tsunami as a warning for all."
Hint: when you see the "lifeguard" radical, the reading is probably going to be こう.
Ru_Notes:
Не путать: 構 (かまえる、コウ строение, поза, забота, беспокойство о чём-то), 購 (コウ покупка, подписка), 講 (コウ лекция).
Не путать: 濠 (ほり、ゴウ、コウ ров, канал), 壕 (ほり、コウ、ゴウ окоп, траншея).

Kanshudo_mnemonic: water (氵) in a well again (冓) = a ditch
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Your cast got all soggy when you fell in the ditch filled with water.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and "冓", the original meaning is field watercourse. "Shu Wen": "Water is four feet wide and four feet deep. From the water, the sound is loud." "Zhou Li‧ Kao Gong Ji‧ Craftsman": "Nine husbands are a well, and the well is four feet wide and four feet deep. , Called the ditch."

" Ditch " can generally refer to all waterways. "Zhuangzi‧ Geng Sangchu": "In the ordinary ditch of the husband, the giant fish has nothing to return to its body, but the salamander is made by it."

" Ditch " also specifically refers to the moat. "Historical Records: The Family of Emperor Qi Taigong": "Chu Fangcheng is a city, Jianghan is a ditch."

" Ditch " also refers to trenches dug manually. "Han Feizi ‧ Shuo Linxia": "The general is angry, and he will build a deep ditch."

" Ditch " is also used as a verb to mean digging a trench. "Guanzi·Dudi": "The height of the ground leads to the ditch, and the bottom leads to the embankment. The fate is called the golden city."

" Gutter " also means partition. "Zuo Zhuan-Ding AD": "The envoy of Ji Sun is like Kan, and the Gong clan will ditch Yan." Du pre-note: "Ji Sun is evil and Zhao Gong, and he wants to divulge his omnipotent domain, so that he will not be the same as his ancestor."

Things similar to the groove are also called " ditch ." Song Su Shi, "Juxingtang Xue": "Fuzzy cypress alone has been alone for a long time, and a glimpse of the chaos and chaos."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and "冓", the original meaning is field watercourse.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「冓」聲，本義為田間水道。《說文》：「水瀆，廣四尺，深四尺。从水，冓聲。」《周禮‧考工記‧匠人》：「九夫為井，井間廣四尺，深四尺，謂之溝。」

　　「溝」可泛指一切通水道。《莊子‧庚桑楚》：「夫尋常之溝，巨魚無所還其體，而鯢鰍為之制。」

　　「溝」也特指護城河。《史記‧齊太公世家》：「楚方城以為城，江漢以為溝。」

　　「溝」還指人工挖掘的戰壕。《韓非子‧說林下》：「將軍怒，將深溝高壘。」

　　「溝」亦用作動詞，表示挖溝。《管子‧度地》：「地高則溝之，下則隄之，命之曰金城。」

　　「溝」還表示隔斷。《左傳‧定公元年》：「季孫使役如闞，公氏將溝焉。」杜預注：「季孫惡昭公，欲溝絕其兆域，不使其與先君同。」

　　與溝形類似之物也稱為「溝」。宋蘇軾〈聚星堂雪〉：「糢糊檜頂獨多時，歷亂瓦溝裁一瞥。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「冓」聲，本義為田間水道。

從「 水 」，「 冓 」聲，本義為田間水道。《說文》：「水瀆，廣四尺，深四尺。从水，冓聲。」《周禮‧考工記‧匠人》：「九夫為井，井間廣四尺，深四尺，謂之溝。」 「 溝 」可泛指一切通水道。《莊子‧庚桑楚》：「夫尋常之溝，巨魚無所還其體，而鯢鰍為之制。」 「 溝 」也特指護城河。《史記‧齊太公世家》：「楚方城以為城，江漢以為溝。」 「 溝 」還指人工挖掘的戰壕。《韓非子‧說林下》：「將軍怒，將深溝高壘。」 「 溝 」亦用作動詞，表示挖溝。《管子‧度地》：「地高則溝之，下則隄之，命之曰金城。」 「 溝 」還表示隔斷。《左傳‧定公元年》：「季孫使役如闞，公氏將溝焉。」杜預注：「季孫惡昭公，欲溝絕其兆域，不使其與先君同。」 與溝形類似之物也稱為「 溝 」。宋蘇軾〈聚星堂雪〉：「糢糊檜頂獨多時，歷亂瓦溝裁一瞥。」
From the sound of " water" and " 冓", the original meaning is field watercourse. "Shu Wen": "Water is four feet wide and four feet deep. From the water, the sound is loud." "Zhou Li‧ Kao Gong Ji‧ Craftsman": "Nine husbands are a well, and the well is four feet wide and four feet deep. , Called the ditch." " Ditch" can generally refer to all waterways. "Zhuangzi‧ Geng Sangchu": "In the ordinary ditch of the husband, the giant fish has nothing to return to its body, but the salamander is made by it." " Ditch" also specifically refers to the moat. "Historical Records: The Family of Emperor Qi Taigong": "Chu Fangcheng is a city, Jianghan is a ditch." " Ditch" also refers to trenches dug manually. "Han Feizi ‧ Shuo Linxia": "The general is angry, and he will build a deep ditch." " Ditch" is also used as a verb to mean digging a trench. "Guanzi·Dudi": "The height of the ground leads to the ditch, and the bottom leads to the embankment. The fate is called the golden city." " Gutter" also means partition. "Zuo Zhuan-Ding AD": "The envoy of Ji Sun is like Kan, and the Gong clan will ditch Yan." Du pre-note: "Ji Sun is evil and Zhao Gong, and he wants to divulge his omnipotent domain, so that he will not be the same as his ancestor." Things similar to the groove are also called " ditch." Song Su Shi, "Juxingtang Xue": "Fuzzy cypress alone has been alone for a long time, and a glimpse of the chaos and chaos."

溝字的基本解释

溝
gōu
见“沟”。

溝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gōu］
［《廣韻》古侯切，平侯，見。］
“沟1”的繁体字。
(1)田间水道。
(2)泛指一切通水道。
(3)特指护城河。
(4)人工挖掘的战壕。
(5)泛指与沟形类似之物。
(6)挖沟。
(7)隔断。
(8)指山冲。
(9)数目名。
[②]［kòu］
［《字彙》丘候切］
“沟2”的繁体字。
见“溝2瞀”。

溝字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　溝； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页639第34
【唐韻】古侯切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】居侯切，?音鉤。【說文】水瀆，廣四尺，深四尺。【釋名】田閒之水曰溝。溝，搆也。縱橫相交搆也。【周禮·地官】遂人十夫有溝。　又【爾雅·釋水】水註谷曰溝。　又溝池，城塹也。【禮·禮運】城郭溝池以爲固。　又汗溝，馬中脊也。【齊民要術】相馬法，汗溝欲其深。　又【集韻】古項切，音講。與港同。水分流也。詳港字註。　又【韻補】叶斤於切，音居。【焦氏·易林】馬驚破車，王孫墜溝，身死魂去，離其室廬。

溝字的源字形

小篆楷体

вм. 沟
Radicals: 氵, 冓  (tsunami, lifeguard)
Meaning Mnemonic
Tsunami vs lifeguard. Who will win? After the water drains away, we find the lifeguard in the gutter.
To be fair, it's pretty obvious who would win. Nobody knows what that lifeguard was thinking.
Reading Mnemonic
In the gutter is a lifeguard, so Emperor こういち decides to survey the damage.
"This lifeguard didn't believe in the power of kanji learning," こういち says to the press. "He was punished by the great Crabigator, who sent its tsunami as a warning for all."
Hint: when you see the "lifeguard" radical, the reading is probably going to be こう.
